intro: Striga gesnerioides, commonly known as the ghost flower or devil's bit, is a flowering plant belonging to the Orobanchaceae family. It is a hemiparasitic plant, meaning it partially relies on host plants for water and nutrients while performing photosynthesis. Native to parts of Africa, it is often found growing on the roots of grasses and other herbaceous plants. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late summer. Its unique appearance and parasitic nature make it an intriguing subject in botanical studies.
